metadata.title: CVE-2022-22827 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
storeAtts in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3 has an integeroverflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22827` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libxmltok1 - 1.2-3ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2').
xmlrpc-c package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
vnc4 package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
insighttoolkit package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
insighttoolkit4 package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
ayttm package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
cableswig package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
coin3 package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
vtk package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
libxmltok package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-3ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm2').
